info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:27PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hardeman, southeastern Haywood and southwestern Madison Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 727 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dancyville, or 7 miles south of Brownsville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownsville, Hillville, Dancyville, Cloverport, Mercer, Asbury, Huntersville, Cedar Chapel, Vildo, Hickory Point, Hatchie, Uptonville, Sunnyhill, Morton Hill, Shepp, Denmark and Leighton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
